lines.text: Driver, who were those men we saw?
They are not men, madame. They are dead bodies!
I thought that beauty alone would satisfy. But the soul is gone. I can't bear those empty, staring eyes.
I kissed her as she lay there in the coffin; and her lips were cold.
[On pitching woo to a zombie]
Just give me a month. One little month!
But there must be another way.
There is no other way!
Your driver believed he saw dead men... walking.
You must bring her back!
Aren't you a trifle afraid, monsieur? How do you suppose those eyes will regard you when the brain is able to understand?
Better to see hatred in them than that dreadful emptiness.
Not dead? Are you mad? I saw her die. The doctor signed the certificate. I saw them bury her.

Now wait a minute, wait a minute, I'm not mad. But I've lived in these islands for a good many years. And I've seen things with my eyes that made me think I was crazy. There's superstition in Haiti that the natives brought here from Africa. Some can be traced back as far as ancient Egypt. And beyong that yet in the countries that was old when Egypt was young.
Surely you don't think she's alive, in the hands of natives. Oh no! Better dead than that.
Before we get through with this thing we may uncover sins that even the devil would be ashamed of.
[first lines]
Looks like a burial.
In the road?
I'm sorry to have kept you waiting, monsieur. I've been away on a journey, seeking more men for my mill.
Men?
They work faithfully; they are not worried about long hours. You... you could make good use of men like mine on your plantation?
Zombies!
Yes, they are my servants. Did you think we could do it alone? In their lifetime, they were my enemies.
Who are you?
[looks around at the zombies]
And what are they?
For you, my friend, they are the angels of death.
Driver, what is it?
It's a funeral, ma'm'selle. They're afraid of the men who steal dead bodies, so they dig the graves in the middle of the road where people pass all the time.
Just a pinpoint monsieur. In a flower. Or perhaps in a glass of wine.
[last lines]
Madeline, my darling...
Neil, I... I dreamed.
Excuse me, please. Have you got a match?
